page.title: 0420TH CENT.CHANGES IN RAINHAM
page.content: We spoke to Mrs.Wheeler and Mrs Bunting of Longford Court Old Peoples Home.They said that Rainham had once been a small village with only 2 schools.One school was near the Station and had 6 classes. Pupils wrote on slates and there were {60 children} in each class.They did not have any lunch canteen.54 years ago a main drainage system was built.Some houses were very poor,with houses built of {cow dung.} Many people went {fruit picking} in the local farms.Apples,cherries,Hops and Raspberries were common.On windy days the pickers had to be tied to the ladders so that they did not fall to the ground. At school many games were popular some which we still play today.They played {hopscotch,marbles and spinning tops}.The ladies also remembered the {Trams} that ran from Gillingham.
